title: Google\Cloud\Speech\V1\RecognitionMetadata
name: RecognitionMetadata
description:
Description of audio data to be recognized.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.speech.v1.RecognitionMetadata

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.interaction_type
params.description: The use case most closely describing the audio content to be recognized.

params.name: data.industry_naics_code_of_audio
params.description: The industry vertical to which this speech recognition request most closely applies. This is most indicative of the topics contained in the audio. Use the 6-digit NAICS code to identify the industry vertical - see https://www.naics.com/search/.

params.name: data.microphone_distance
params.description: The audio type that most closely describes the audio being recognized.

params.name: data.original_media_type
params.description: The original media the speech was recorded on.

params.name: data.recording_device_type
params.description: The type of device the speech was recorded with.

params.name: data.recording_device_name
params.description: The device used to make the recording. Examples 'Nexus 5X' or 'Polycom SoundStation IP 6000' or 'POTS' or 'VoIP' or 'Cardioid Microphone'.

params.name: data.original_mime_type
params.description: Mime type of the original audio file. For example audio/m4a, audio/x-alaw-basic, audio/mp3, audio/3gpp. A list of possible audio mime types is maintained at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#audio

params.name: data.audio_topic
params.description: Description of the content. Eg. "Recordings of federal supreme court hearings from 2012".
